Authorization.description: Contains the Bearer Token for OAuth 2.0. Example value "Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsIng1d_etc"
Authorization.name: Authorization

PSU-Accept.description: The forwarded header field of the HTTP request between PSU and TPP, if available. Example value "text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,image/apng,*/*;q=0.8"
PSU-Accept.name: PSU-Accept

PSU-Accept-Charset.description: The forwarded header field of the HTTP request between PSU and TPP, if available. Example value "ISO-8859-1"
PSU-Accept-Charset.name: PSU-Accept-Charset

PSU-Accept-Encoding.description: The forwarded header field of the HTTP request between PSU and TPP, if available. Example value "gzip, deflate"
PSU-Accept-Encoding.name: PSU-Accept-Encoding

PSU-Accept-Language.description: The forwarded header field of the HTTP request between PSU and TPP, if available. Example value "en-US,en;q=0.9,sv;q=0.8"
PSU-Accept-Language.name: PSU-Accept-Language

PSU-Corporate-ID.description: Include in any request aimed at accessing corporate accounts or corporate payment types. This is either the 14 digit SEB identifier for the company or the 10 digit organization number. When this header is included all tasks will be performed for this corporation based on the PSU having access rights. Note that this header shall not be present when accessing account information for private accounts.
PSU-Corporate-ID.name: PSU-Corporate-Id

PSU-Device-ID.description: UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) for a device, which is used by the PSU, if available. Example value "05a18f38-c218-4d1c-a9d0-ac36763580e1"
PSU-Device-ID.name: PSU-Device-ID

PSU-Geo-Location.description: The forwarded Geo Location of the corresponding HTTP request between PSU and TPP if available. See RFC2426. Example value "GEO:52.506931,13.144558"
PSU-Geo-Location.name: PSU-Geo-Location

PSU-Http-Method.description: HTTP method used at the PSU – TPP interface, if available. Example value "POST"
PSU-Http-Method.name: PSU-Http-Method

PSU-ID.description: Send in an expected user-id to verify that the used Authorization token matches the user expected. Can be set to 10 or 12 digit personal number, or a 6 digit XID
PSU-ID.name: PSU-ID

PSU-ID-Type.description: Checks if the correct type of user is checked in. PERSNR checks that PSU is logged in using a personal number (can still be either private or corporate user), whereas XID checks that a SEB corporate user is logged in using an SEB specific ID
PSU-ID-Type.name: PSU-ID-Type

PSU-IP-Address.description: The IP Address of the PSU, as determined in the communication between PSU and TPP, must be provided if the PSU actively requests information. If this value is not provided, then the call will count towards the number of TPP calls without PSU interaction. Leave it empty if the end user is not actively requesting account information Provided in either IPv4 or IPv6 format. Example value "129.178.88.88"
PSU-IP-Address.name: PSU-IP-Address

PSU-IP-Port.description: The forwarded header field of the HTTP request between PSU and TPP, if available. Example value "8080"
PSU-IP-Port.name: PSU-IP-Port

PSU-User-Agent.description: The forwarded header field of the HTTP request between PSU and TPP, if available. Example value "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/66.0.3359.181 Safari/537.36"
PSU-User-Agent.name: PSU-User-Agent

X-Request-ID.description: ID of the request as set by the initiating party, a unique value should be used for each request. Same value will be returned as a header with each successful call. Suggested for use with GUIDs, but any string is valid.
X-Request-ID.name: X-Request-ID

accountId.description: Unique id that identifies specific account. Example value "8386f81a-10a3-4b8a-a10d-de58adf4706d"
accountId.name: accountId

bookingStatus.description:
Filter booked transactions by status. Possible value is "booked", "pending" or "both".
* Mandatory parameter.
bookingStatus.name: bookingStatus

dateFrom.description:
Filter transactions by a from date.
Example value "2018-06-01".
* Optional parameter.
dateFrom.name: dateFrom

dateTo.description:
Filter transactions by a to date.
Example value "2018-06-30"
* Optional parameter.
dateTo.name: dateTo

paginationKey.description: Internal parameter used when paging, value is equivalent to first row in next result set. Please do not modify this value during a page request.
paginationKey.name: paginationKey

transactionId.description: Unique id that identifies a specific transaction. Example value Nzs4MDE3OTAwMDQ5Uzs7OzIwMTgtMDEtMTg7Ozs4MDE3OTAwMDQ5Uzs7
transactionId.name: transactionId

withBalance.description:
If balances should be shown for accounts in the list.
* Excluding this parameter defaults to "false".
* Including this parameter with a false value will hide balances in the request.
* Including this parameter with a true value will show balances in the request.
* An empty or non-valid value for this parameter is not allowed and will give an exception.
withBalance.name: withBalance

transactions.description: Link to corresponding booked transactions list API.

additionalOwnerNames.description: List with names of additional account owners.

bic.description: Bank identifier used for international transactions.

cardLinkedToAccount.description: Describes if there is at least one card linked to the account.

creditLine.description: Credit amount for the account in account currency.

name.description: Account name given by the user.

ownerId.description: The account holder´s id only present for corporate users.

paymentService.description: Describes if payment service is connected to the account.

product.description:
SEB product name for this account, proprietary definition

For an account belonging to private individuals the following products will be returned
* Privatkonto - A transaction account for everyday economy. It is possible to connect a card or payment service to the account.
* Enkla sparkonto - An account for savings. It is not possible to connect a card or payment service to the account but it is possible to make money transfers from and to the account.
* Personallönekonto -	A transaction account for everyday economy.
* Valutakonto - A transaction account in other currency than SEK.  It is not possible to connect a card or payment service to the account but it is possible to make money transfers from and to the account.
* Notariatkonto - An account connected to a SEB custody account. It is not possible to connect a card or payment service to the account or to make money transfers from the account. It is possible to make money transfers to the account.

resourceId.description: This is the data element to be used in the path when retrieving data from a dedicated account. Used for the transactions and balance endpoint.

status.description: Status of the account. Terminated accounts will have status ''deleted'', active accounts ''enabled''.

statusDate.description: Date when current status was set, shown for statuses other than enabled. I.e. for status ''deleted'' the date of deletion will be shown. Date is in YYYY-MM-dd format.

_links.description: Contains a link related to the account's transactions.

bic.description: Bank identifier used for international transactions.

creditLine.description: Credit amount for the account in account currency.

name.description: Account name given by the user.

ownerId.description: The account holder´s id only present for corporate users.

product.description:
SEB product name for this account, proprietary definition

For an account belonging to private individuals the following products will be returned
* Privatkonto - A transaction account for everyday economy. It is possible to connect a card or payment service to the account.
* Enkla sparkonto - An account for savings. It is not possible to connect a card or payment service to the account but it is possible to make money transfers from and to the account.
* Personallönekonto -	A transaction account for everyday economy.
* Valutakonto - A transaction account in other currency than SEK.  It is not possible to connect a card or payment service to the account but it is possible to make money transfers from and to the account.
* Notariatkonto - An account connected to a SEB custody account. It is not possible to connect a card or payment service to the account or to make money transfers from the account. It is possible to make money transfers to the account.

resourceId.description: This is the data element to be used in the path when retrieving data from a dedicated account. Used for the transactions and balance endpoint.

status.description: Status of the account. Terminated accounts will have status ''deleted'', active accounts ''enabled''.

statusDate.description: Date when current status was set, shown for statuses other than enabled. I.e. for status ''deleted'' the date of deletion will be shown. Date is in YYYY-MM-dd format.

_links.description: Contains links related to the account's transactions.

accountInterest.description: Interest for the account. Only valid for accounts belonging to private individuals.

aliases.description:
These aliases are used to access payment accounts without knowing the actual account. Example of aliases are bgnr and msisdn.
An alias of type msisdn is an alias to access a payment account via a registered mobile phone number.
In Sweden type msisdn is called the Swish, in Norway it is called Vipps and in Denmark and Finland it is called MobilePay.
An alias of type bgnr is a swedish bankgiro payment.
List of account aliases can only be present for corporate accounts.

interestConditions.description: Interest rate information list. Valid for corporate accounts

accrued.description: Accrued interest list. Maximum 190 interest postings. Minimum 0 postings.

posted.description: Interest posting list. Maximum 190 interest postings. Minimum 0 postings.

id.description: Contains the id, the value, of the alias, in this case it is the bankgiro number to the Red Cross in Sweden.

type.description: Contiains the type of the alias, in this case it is bgnr (bankgiro)

currency.description: Currency code for amount in balance

balanceType.description: Describes the balance type. Interim booked is the balance calculated using only booked transactions. Interim available is the balance calculated including booked, reserved and pending amounts.

creditLimitIncluded.description: Indicates if credit-limit is included in the balance amount.

accruedCreditInterestAmount.description: The calculated accrued interest since last capitalization. Credit interest - interest according to deposited funds on the account

accruedCreditInterestAmountAdjusted.description: The adjusted interest since last capitalization. Credit interest - interest according to deposited funds on the account

accruedCreditInterestIndicator.description:
Indicates wheater the interest is to be posted to the account.
* true - The interest will be credited
* false - The interest will not be credited

accruedDebitInterestAmount.description: The calculated accrued interest since last capitalization. Debit interest - interest according to used overdraft facilities

accruedDebitInterestAmountAdjusted.description: The adjusted interest since last capitalization. Debit interest - interest according to used overdraft facilities

accruedDebitInterestIndicator.description:
Indicates wheater the interest is to be posted to the account.
* true - The interest will be debited
* false - The interest will not be debited

accruedPenaltyInterestAmount.description: The calculated accrued interest since last capitalization. Penalty interest - interest according to unauthorized overdraft

accruedPenaltyInterestAmountAdjusted.description: The adjusted interest since last capitalization. Penalty interest - interest according to unauthorized overdraft

accruedPenaltyInterestAmountAdjustedLP.description: The adjusted interest since last capitalization. Penalty interest - interest according to unauthorized overdraft

accruedPenaltyInterestAmountLP.description: The calculated accrued interest since last capitalization. Penalty interest - interest according to unauthorized overdraft

interestDate.description: Interest date. The date to which accrued interest is calculated

pdAccountability.description:
Describes if interest is internal within the company or external between the company and SEB.
Internal - no effect on SEB balance sheet.
External - effects SEB balance sheet.

interestCapitalizationPostingDate.description: Interest Posting Date. Date when the capitalization was made and posted to the account.

interestType.description:
Interest type. Distinguishes between interest according to whether interest has been debited or credited to an account, and what terms are valid for the capitalization.
* Credit - deposit
* Debit - overdraft facilities
* Penalty - unauthorized overdraft
* CreditAdjust - deposit adjustment
* DebitAdjust - overdraft facilities adjustment
* PenaltyAdjust - penalty adjustment
* CreditLP - deposit Liquidity Pooling
* DebitLP - overdraft facility Liquidity Pooling
* PenaltyLP - unauthorized overdraft Liquidity Pooling

pdAccountability.description:
Describes if interest is internal within the company or external between the company and SEB.
* Internal - no effect on SEB balance sheet.
* External - effects SEB balance sheet.

error.description: When contacting customer support, please provide entire error structure.

code.description: Message code to explain the nature of the underlying error.

detail.description: Detailed human readable text specific to this instance of the error.
detail.example: Parameter bookingStatus has invalid value. Should be booked, pending or both.

title.description: Short human readable description of error type.
title.example: Format of certain request fields are not matching the XS2A requirements.

type.description: A URI reference that identifies the problem type.

calculationBase.description:
Describes which interest rate(s) is used for interest calculation. Either calculated per indivdual tier or calculated for the tier where the balance is positioned. Example Balance = 350.
* PerTier - 100 x1%, 200 x2%, 50 x3%.
* OnTotal - 350 x3%

interestRateType.description:
Interest rate type.
* Fixed - a fixed rate
* Regular - a rate that varies.
* BaseRate - a reference rate model is a base and then rate is a margin.

interestType.description:
Interest rate type. Distinguishes between interest rates according to whether interest is to be paid by or paid to an account.
* Credit - deposit
* Debit - overdraft facility
* DebitOKred - temporay overdraft facility.
* Penalty - unauthorized overdraft.
* CreditLP - deposit Liquidity Pooling
* DebitLP - overdraft facility Liquidity Pooling
* PenaltyLP - unauthorized overdraft Liquidity Pooling
* CreditAdjust - deposit adjustment
* DebitAdjust - overdraft facilities adjustment
* PenaltyAdjust - penalty adjustment

pdAccountability.description:
Describes if interest is internal within the company or external between the company and SEB.
* Internal - no effect on SEB balance sheet.
* External - effects SEB balance sheet.

tiers.description: Interest tier list. Maximum 4 tiers. Minimum 1 tier.

dayCountConvention.description:
Day count convention, describes how many days that are used for the interest calculation.
* 1/360 - 30 days per months
* 1/ACT - actual number of days per a year. (365,366)

effectiveDate.description: The date from which the condition is valid

interestCapitalizationFrequence.description: Describes how often the interest is capitalised. A number of months between the capitalisations. Example; 1 means every month.

interestRate.description: Specifies the percentage that is used for interest calculation on the account. The added values of the base rate and the margin.

pegAmount.description: Peg amount, describes the balance amount on an account for which no interest is calculated/credited

upperBalance.description: The upper balance to which the interest rate applies for current tier. Example; Tier 1 - 1000, Tier 2 - 2000, tier 3 - 999999999999999,999 Last tier is always a maximum numeric value.

endOfDayLimit.description: Customer internal limit for N, C or T accounts

intraDayLimit.description: Customer internal limit for M and Q accounts

pendingType.description: If pending transaction is "upcoming" or "reserved" amount. Not applicable to booked transactions.

remittanceInformationStructuredReference.description: Swedish domestic BankGiro/PlusGiro payment OCR number. Contains value if OCR was entered or other type of structured reference.

remittanceInformationUnstructuredArray.description: Information from the (ultimate) debtor to the (ultimate) creditor to the reason behind the transaction.

currency.description: Currency code, same as account currency.

valueDate.description: Date when transaction is booked, accounting wise.

transactionDetail.description: Transaction details for given account and transaction id.

bookingDate.description: The Date when an entry is posted to the account

amount.description: The amount of the transaction in local currency.

creditorAccount.description: Transaction credit account, the beneficiary’s account number, 'to' account

bankgiroNumber.description: Account number in Swedish domestic BankGiro format.

bban.description: Identification, on local (proprietary BBAN format), of the account of the creditor to which a credit entry has been posted as a result of the transaction

iban.description: Identification, on IBAN format, of the account of the creditor to which a credit entry has been posted as a result of the transaction

msisdn.description: The mobile phone number used as alias to identify the  account of the creditor to which a credit entry has been posted as a result of the transaction

plusgiroNumber.description: Account number in Swedish domestic PlusGiro format.

creditorAgentBic.description: The bic of the Financial institution servicing an account for the creditor

creditorAgentBranchCode.example: THE BANK OF NEW YORK MELLON

creditorAgentName.description: The name of the Financial institution servicing an account for the creditor

creditorAgentNameAddress.description: The name and address of the Financial institution servicing an account for the creditor

creditorCountryOfResidence.description: Cross border. The country identifier for recipient.

creditorId.description: Unique and unambigous identification of the creditor

debtorAccount.description: Transaction debit account, the remitter account, 'from' account

bankgiroNumber.description: Account number in Swedish domestic BankGiro format.

bban.description: Identification, on local (proprietary BBAN format), of the account of the debtor to which a debit entry has been posted as a result of the transaction

iban.description: Identification, on IBAN format, of the account of the debtor to which a debit entry has been posted as a result of the transaction

msisdn.description: The mobile phone number used as alias to identify the  account of the debtor to which a debit entry has been posted as a result of the transaction

plusgiroNumber.description: Account number in Swedish domestic PlusGiro format.

debtorAgentName.description: The name of the Financial institution servicing an account for the debtor

debtorCountryOfResidence.description: Country in which the debtor resides (i.e. lives). If the debtor is a company, it is the country from which the affairs of that company are directed.

debtorId.description: The unique and unambigous identification of the debtor.

debtorNameAndAddress.description: The name and address of the debtor

debtorReference.description: Debtor's own note on the transaction.

amount.description: Amount in currency before any exchange.

message.description: Debtor's own message on the debit account

proprietaryBankTransactionCodeText.description:
SEB transaction type text.
* Direct debit
* Card purchase
* Card cash withdrawal
* Card ATM
* Card foreign purchase
* Card foreign cash withdrawal
* Card foreign ATM
* Payment (bg/pg)
* Instant payment (Swish)
* Transfer
* Incoming foreign payment
* Outgoing foreign payment

remittanceInformationStructuredReference.description: Swedish domestic BankGiro/PlusGiro payment OCR number. Contains value if OCR was entered or other type of structured reference.

remittanceInformationUnstructuredArray.description: Information from the (ultimate) debtor to the (ultimate) creditor to the reason behind the transaction.

thirdPartyProviderName.description: Name of the third party provider who initiated the transaction

thirdPartyProviderReference.description: The third party provider's unique reference to the transaction. Value is typically a GUID

thirdPartyProviderRegTimestamp.description: A date and timestamp when payment was received by SEB.

amount.description: The amount of the transaction as posted to the account

currency.description: The currency of the transaction as posted to the account

ultimateCreditor.description: The ultimate party to which the amount was due.

ultimateCreditorId.description: The unique and unambigous identification of the ultimate party to which the amount was due.

ultimateDebtor.description: The ultimate party that owed an amount of money to the (ultimate) creditor.

ultimateDebtorId.description: The unique and unambigous identification of the ultimate party that owed an amount of money to the (ultimate) creditor.

valueDate.description: Date at which assets become available to the account owner in case of a credit entry, or cease to be available to the account owner in case of a debit entry

_links.description: Contains links related to this transaction.

transactionDetails.description: Link to corresponding transaction detail API. If this link is missing there are no additional details for the transaction.

balanceAfterTransaction.description: Account balance after transaction is made.

proprietaryBankTransactionCodeText.description:
SEB transaction type text.
* Direct debit
* Card purchase
* Card cash withdrawal
* Card ATM
* Card foreign purchase
* Card foreign cash withdrawal
* Card foreign ATM
* Payment (bg/pg)
* Instant payment (Swish)
* Transfer
* Incoming foreign payment
* Outgoing foreign payment
* Other

currency.description: Currency code, same as account currency.

transactionId.description: This id should be used when retrieving transaction details.

valueDate.description: Date when transaction is booked, accounting wise.

transactionsList.description: A list of transactions for an account.

account.description: Relative path back to the account.

next.description: Only shown if more than 500 booked transactions are available. This link will retrieve the next page of transactions. Following a paging link of a transaction list will not count towards the number times (per day) the account transaction operation has been called.

get.description:
Listed accounts are those where the user is account holder or has corporate account access and where the account type is PSD2 supported. Accessing corporate accounts can be done by setting the PSU-Corporate-Id header in this and other account endpoints. In production this needs to be combined with calling in with a corporate client-id.
SEB will always return all accounts that are PSD2 supported, there is no detailed consent that limits account accessibility. Terminated accounts will also be shown in the list for several months (same limit as other online channels).
The following account types are part of PSD2 for private individuals
* Privatkonto; A transaction account for everyday economy. It is possible to connect a card or payment service to the account.
* Enkla sparkonto; An account for savings. It is not possible to connect a card or payment service to the account but it is possible to make money transfers from and to the account.
* Personallönekonto; A transaction account for everyday economy.
* Valutakonto; A transaction account in other currency than SEK.  It is not possible to connect a card or payment service to the account but it is possible to make money transfers from and to the account.
* Notariatkonto; An account connected to a SEB custody account. It is not possible to connect a card or payment service to the account or to make money transfers from the account. It is possible to make money transfers to the account.
The account REST structure uses an anonymised resource identifier to access account information. In order to query for transactions and balances, a resource identifier must be fetched. Use the account list endpoint to get the resource ids for all accounts. The resource id for each account will not change over time, so it can be stored and reused for subsequent calls.
Account information services can be called unlimited times if the end user is actively requesting information. Account information services can be called 4 times a day (reset at midnight) without the end user actively requesting information and this is 4 times per user, per account and per account information operation. To indicate that the end user is actively requesting account information, please provide the IP adress of the end user in the header 'PSU-IP-Address' for the relevant operation call; otherwise omit the header.'

400.description:
Error caused by bad input data.
Example causes include
* Not including required input parameters, such as 'Accept' header.
* Requesting information for a customer without appropriate access.

429.description:
Error caused by exceeding unattended accesses to api.
Example causes include
* Calling to this api and account combination too many times in one day without an associated PSU-IP-Address.
* Calls including PSU-IP-Address header will not count against unattended access limit, but should only be included when there is an active customer.
*Calls exceeding the rate limit 15 TPS (transaction per second).

500.description:
Internal server error.
* Error caused by remote technical issues, this status code is used for unforeseen technical issues
* Please contact support and include information from the instance field.

503.description:
Service unavailable.
* Returned when service is unavailable due to scheduled reasons, such as maintenance.

get.summary: Returns a list of a user´s accounts.

get.description:
Returns detailed account information, with or without balances for one specific account. This endpoint returns more detailed information about the account than the account list. Examples of detailed information is account interest.
The accountId, that is supplied in the request path, is the "resourceId" attribute of the account structure returned by the account list endpoint.

200.description: One account is returned, links to additional services for the single account are included.

400.description:
Error caused by bad input data.
Example causes include
* Not including required input parameters, such as 'Accept' header.
* Requesting information for a customer without appropriate access.

404.description:
Not found.
* Requesting a non-existent account id will give this error.
* Requesting incorrectly constructed URLs will return this error

429.description:
Error caused by exceeding unattended accesses to api.
Example causes include
* Calling to this api and account combination too many times in one day without an associated PSU-IP-Address.
* Calls including PSU-IP-Address header will not count against unattended access limit, but should only be included when there is an active customer.

500.description:
Internal server error.
* Error caused by remote technical issues, this status code is used for unforeseen technical issues
* Please contact support and include information from the instance field.

get.summary: Returns detailed account information, potentially including balances for one specific account.

get.description:
Returns balances for booked transactions and available amount (including any credit limit) for the account.
* interimBooked, current balance calculated using only booked transactions.
* interimAvailable current balance calculated including booked, reserved and pending amounts.
The accountId, that is supplied in the request path, is the "resourceId" attribute of the account structure returned by the account list endpoint.

200.description: Balances for one account are listed.

400.description:
Error caused by bad input data.
Example causes include
* Not including required input parameters, such as 'Accept' header.
* Requesting information for a customer without appropriate access.

500.description:
Internal server error.
* Error caused by remote technical issues, this status code is used for unforeseen technical issues
* Please contact support and include information from the instance field.

503.description:
Service unavailable.
* Returned when service is unavailable due to scheduled reasons, such as maintenance.

get.summary: Returns balances for a specific account

get.description:
Returns a list of transactions for one specific account. You can search on account with or without a date period. The transaction list contains both booked transactions and pending transactions (either upcoming payments or reserved amounts).
Requests will be paginated if the result set contains more than 500 booked transactions. A paginated result will contain a next-link and that value can be used to retrieve the next page result. Please use the exact value in the next-link when retrieving page result.
The transactions can be of different types and some of them can have additional details. If the entry has a "transactionDetails" link, use the link reference to access those transaction details.
We recommend the following strategy when fetching transactional data on a daily basis
* Pending transactions are volatile, so fetch all of them on a daily basis.
* Booked transactions are permanent, but they may (very seldom) be corrected during the same day, so use the date delimiter to fetch transactions from today and yesterday to get the current state of booked transactions.
* Do use the filtering options in the account transactions API to fetch only the necessary transactions data that is needed
The accountId, that is supplied in the request path, is the "resourceId" attribute of the account structure returned by the account list endpoint. The IBAN or BBAN can never be used directly to retrieve the transaction list.

400.description:
Error caused by bad input data.
Example causes include
* Not including required input parameters, such as 'Accept' header.
* Requesting information for a customer without appropriate access.

404.description:
Not found.
* Requesting a non-existent account id will give this error.
* Requesting incorrectly constructed URLs will return this error

429.description:
Error caused by exceeding unattended accesses to api.
Example causes include
* Calling to this api and account combination too many times in one day without an associated PSU-IP-Address.
* Calls including PSU-IP-Address header will not count against unattended access limit, but should only be included when there is an active customer.

500.description:
Internal server error.
* Error caused by remote technical issues, this status code is used for unforeseen technical issues
* Please contact support and include information from the instance field.

503.description:
Service unavailable.
* Returned when service is unavailable due to scheduled reasons, such as maintenance.

get.summary: Returns a list of transactions for one specific account.

get.description:
Depending on transaction type, different detail fields will be returned, e.g. exchange rate, message to creditor, place of purchase etc.
The accountId, that is supplied in the request path, is the "resourceId" attribute of the account structure returned by the account list endpoint. The transactionId is returned by the transaction list endpoint.

202.description: The payment execution system is still processing this transaction. It can take up to 15 minutes for the detailed information about a transfer to be finalized after payment execution. Please retry the call in 60 seconds.

400.description:
Error caused by bad input data.
Example causes include
* Not including required input parameters, such as 'Accept' header.
* Requesting information for a customer without appropriate access.

404.description:
Not found.
* Requesting a non-existent account or transactionId will give this error.
* Requesting incorrectly constructed URLs will return this error
* No transaction details are available.

408.description:
Request timeout.
* Requesting transactions with too broad date period can cause a timeout. Limit the date range.

429.description:
Error caused by exceeding unattended accesses to api.
Example causes include
* Calling to this api and account combination too many times in one day without an associated PSU-IP-Address.
* Calls including PSU-IP-Address header will not count against unattended access limit, but should only be included when there is an active customer.

500.description:
Internal server error.
* Error caused by remote technical issues, this status code is used for unforeseen technical issues
* Please contact support and include information from the instance field.

503.description:
Service unavailable.
* Returned when service is unavailable due to scheduled reasons, such as maintenance.

get.summary: Returns transaction details on a specific transaction.
Pings the status of the API
